intro: Eriogonum elongatum, commonly known as the longstem buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Eriogonum elongatum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
